movie_title: Are we getting more allergic to things? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Do you know anyone who has 50 allergies? Neil and Beth discuss this and teach you some new vocabular

vocabulary.definition: lack of ability to tolerate something, such as food or substance, without adverse reactions
vocabulary.example: Neil has dairy intolerance, so he feels bad after consuming milk products.

vocabulary.definition: an allergic reaction to pollen or dust, causing symptoms like sneezing and itching
vocabulary.example: During spring, Sarah suffers from hay fever due to the high pollen count.

vocabulary.definition: a chronic respiratory condition characterized by difficulty breathing and wheezing
vocabulary.example: She carries an inhaler with her at all times due to her asthma.

vocabulary.definition: a substance that causes an allergic reaction in the body
vocabulary.example: Peanuts are a common allergen, causing severe reactions in some individuals.

vocabulary.definition: a medical treatment to enhance the body's immune response to allergens or diseases
vocabulary.example: The doctor recommended immunotherapy to help build her immunity to pollen.

vocabulary.definition: to summarize or review the main points of a topic
vocabulary.example: Before the exam, the teacher will recap the key concepts covered in class.

vocabulary.definition: designed to respond to the actions, commands, or requests of users
vocabulary.example: The new app features an interactive map that allows users to explore different locations.

vocabulary.definition: an approximate calculation or judgment of the value or extent of something
vocabulary.example: They estimated that over 100 people attended the event based on the number of chairs set up.
